id: Habits Mastery Series: Mindset Reset - Rewire Your Thinking for Growth-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Habits Mastery Series: Mindset Reset - Rewire Your Thinking for Growth
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
It’s a mindset that doesn't serve your purpose.
Join us for the next workshop in our Habits Mastery Series: In this interactive 1-hour workshop, you’ll learn: How your beliefs shape your habits and outcomes The difference between a fixed and growth mindset How to shift your internal dialogue and self-image Tools to break limiting beliefs and unlock your potential “Whether you think you can, or you think you can’t — you’re right.” — Henry Ford Walk away with practical tools, inspiring insights, and the motivation to think bigger about your life.
Meet your host, Nava Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud.
Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life.
Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life.

id: Little Creators-Capital E, 4 Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Little Creators
venue: Capital E, 4 Queens Wharf, Wellington
description:
Get creative with Aunty Cara at 11am each Wednesday in PlayHQ!
Come along and try a sensory-based craft.
Tamariki work with new and exciting materials, learning different techniques to make special creations.
Best suits ages 3-5, Little Creators is part of our E Tipu E Rea term-time programme.
Free, donations appreciated.

id: Retirement Reinvented-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Retirement Reinvented
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Whether you’re already retired, or planning ahead, this practical workshop will help you to reflect, re-envision and re-vitalise your life and develop a plan for your future, on your own terms.
(NZ citizen and residents free with ID, all others pay $109).
What’s next?
After the workshop, you’ll be able to identify a number of common issues and potential ways to manage them when considering and planning your “rejuvenation”, rather than a retirement.
By the end of the day, you’ll have: - Developed your own perspective on ageing and retirement in the 21st Century and identified what’s important to you - Completed a personal life audit exercise and considered your strengths - Explored possibilities in the major aspects of your life and identified potential challenges and strategies for overcoming them - Developed a blueprint to maximise the best years of your life and developed a “future proofing” downsizing plan - Considered options to include a sense of purpose and explored and implemented choices that provide you with that sense of purpose Bring a pen and paper.

id: Take a Breathing Break-Johnsonville Library, 34 Moorefield Road, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Take a Breathing Break
venue: Johnsonville Library, 34 Moorefield Road, Wellington
description:
This session isn’t about adding more to your to-do list, it’s about taking something off it: stress, overthinking, and emotional weight.
Through Breath.
In just 45 minutes, you can: 1.
A grounded sense of calm 3.
A taste of what the full programme offers Come take a breathing break.

id: Quiz Night-Parrotdog Bar, 60 - 66 Kingsford Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Parrotdog Bar, 60 - 66 Kingsford Smith St, Wellington
description:
Come join us for the fortnightly ritual on a Thursday night, where you and your crew will negotiate five rounds of amazing trivia with Gee Quiz.
Your team's street cred, life smarts and common sense will go a long way to ensuring success on the night.
Add to the exquisite beers, delicious food and an incredible vibe, it's the place to be on a Thursday night with plenty of time for laughter, banter and merrymaking!
The quiz kicks off at 6.30pm and runs for roughly 2.5 hours.
So, grab your buddies and come on down and join us for one of Wellington's best quiz nights – Parrotdog style!

id: Rogue Sunday Jazz - Emma Hattaway-The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Rogue Sunday Jazz - Emma Hattaway
venue: The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington
description:
The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz.
Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz.
Beer, hangs, and jazz, on a Sunday, perfect!
This week featuring local bassist Emma Hattaway and her band.
Join Emma and friends for an evening celebrating two of jazz’s most original voices.

id: Quiz Night Fundraiser-Wainuiomata Rugby Football Club Inc, 2 Moohan Street, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night Fundraiser
venue: Wainuiomata Rugby Football Club Inc, 2 Moohan Street, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt
description:
Hutt City Chorale are running a quiz night at Wainuiomata Rugby Club to raise funds for our next concert.
Teams up to 8, entry $10 per person.
Bring your own snacks, purchase drinks at the bar.
Register your team and the team name to huttcitychorale@gmail.com or on the night at the door.
Doors open 7pm, the quiz starts 7.30pm.

id: Cooking Classes-Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Cooking Classes
venue: Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington
description:
Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.
Also a private cooking classes available.
3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.
4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi.
Also fresh paneer making.

id: Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
(NZ Citizens and residents pay $109 with ID, all others pay $199).
Description Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1 By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: • Have a basic understanding of the Māori spiritual and natural worlds (mana atua, mana whenua), and our important connections to them • Identify the sounds of Māori letters and pronounce letter combinations using correct intonation and stress patterns • Confidently greet people, introduce yourself and communicate basic personal information in an informal context • Identify and respond to phrases in the classroom including basic commands/instructions • Confidently describe the day/date, time, and the weather NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Quiz Night-Cambridge Hotel, 28 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Cambridge Hotel, 28 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
description:
Looking for the perfect midweek hangout?
Join us for QUIZ NIGHTS every Wednesday at 6:30 PM at The Bridge!
Round up your mates and take on the challenge for a night full of fun, good vibes, and friendly competition.
Enjoy our special $29 Burger & Drink deal while you put your knowledge to the test.
Gather your squad and head over to 28 Cambridge Terrace this Wednesday at 6:30 PM—don't miss out on the fun!

id: 6 Week Back & Neck Care Yoga Course-Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: 6 Week Back & Neck Care Yoga Course
venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Courses focused on Back & Neck Care from the System YOGA IN DAILY LIFE are well-known in Europe for assisting in recovery from back pain, poor posture and neck stiffness.
The consistency and regularity of your yoga practice is an important factor in bringing changes in your back and your general physical state.
Starting: 14 August 10 -11am Booking needed: info@yogaindailylife.org.nz or via our Glofox system, button "Bookings" under the "Courses" Possibility to join a class as a drop in Price: $100 /*$90 (students, holders of Gold card)

id: Retirement Reinvented-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Retirement Reinvented
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Whether you’re already retired, or planning ahead, this practical workshop will help you to reflect, re-envision and re-vitalise your life and develop a plan for your future, on your own terms.
(NZ citizen and residents free with ID, all others pay $109).
What’s next?
After the workshop, you’ll be able to identify a number of common issues and potential ways to manage them when considering and planning your “rejuvenation”, rather than a retirement.
By the end of the day, you’ll have: - Developed your own perspective on ageing and retirement in the 21st Century and identified what’s important to you - Completed a personal life audit exercise and considered your strengths - Explored possibilities in the major aspects of your life and identified potential challenges and strategies for overcoming them - Developed a blueprint to maximise the best years of your life and developed a “future proofing” downsizing plan - Considered options to include a sense of purpose and explored and implemented choices that provide you with that sense of purpose Bring a pen and paper.

id: Pelvic Power Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Pelvic Power Workshop
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
These Feldenkrais Method® techniques will help you regain muscle efficiency and tone.
For women only.
You'll learn to differentiate different parts of the pelvic floor, and also how the pelvic floor functions in conjunction with breathing and spinal movements.
By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to: -Recognise the anatomy of the pelvic floor, where the muscles are and how they work - Coordinate the pelvic floor muscles with breathing, and with the spine, and recognise its role in overall good posture - Discover what habits you have which work against your pelvic floor muscles working well - Practise exercises designed to help you rehabilitate and strengthen your pelvic floor Please note that instructions are given verbally rather than by demonstration, so good hearing and understanding of English is required.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: InDuna - Go High - EP Release-Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: InDuna - Go High - EP Release
venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington
description:
Join Afro-Kiwi artist InDuna to celebrate the release of his brand new EP, ‘Go High’, live at Moon, Wellington on Saturday 2nd August.
‘Go High’ is a gift from InDuna’s younger self to the artist he is today.
It's an uplifting and reflective Afro-pop project inspired by his South African roots and journey of resilience.
The EP is a reminder to keep dreaming boldly, no matter the obstacles.
Doors open: 9:00 PM Show starts: 9:30 PM Venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington Moon is a wheelchair-accessible venue with both seated and standing options available.

id: Negotiation Skills for Successful Outcomes-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Negotiation Skills for Successful Outcomes
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
(NZ citizens and residents free with ID, others pay $100).
To arm you with the strategies, skills, and mindset to walk into any negotiation and leave with the outcome you desire.
Own the Room: Master the art of negotiation strategy, use space to your advantage, and know the unspoken rules.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
GST NZ Residents and Citizens $0.00 incl.

id: Quiz Night-Heyday Beer Co, 264a Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Heyday Beer Co, 264a Cuba St, Wellington
description:
Quiz night is back at Heyday Beer Co. with Welly's own Savage behind the mic!
With five rounds of trivia, you and your squad will negotiate engaging, relevant and left-field questions that you have a fighting chance to get correct, regardless of your background or how many Master's degrees you have.
In addition to the epic trivia, we've got get-up-out-of-your-seat games The Line Up and Last Person Standing to mix things up.
It's the place to be every Wednesday night!
Pet friendly so your four-legged friends are welcome!

id: Quiz Night-The Crooked Elm, 25 Laings Rd, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: The Crooked Elm, 25 Laings Rd, Lower Hutt
description:
Every Thursday is quiz night at one of Lower Hutt's best venues - The Crooked Elm!
Kicking off at 6.30pm, the quiz offers five rounds of big-screen trivia that's not too hard, not too easy, but includes content that relates to you and your crew!
So if you've got some street smarts, a good attitude, and a dash of luck, you'll be a good chance on the night.
Add to the mix some bonus games, great food & drink, a stack of prizes, great banter and laughs aplenty, it's the place to be on a Tuesday for a rollicking good time!

id: Pottery - Handbuilding Basics-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Pottery - Handbuilding Basics
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Understand shrinkage and clay care, joining techniques, drape and press moulding, mark making, slip making and application - as well as tetrahedron, cone and cylinder production The techniques learnt during the making will provide an excellent springboard to creating a wide array of ceramic objects in the future.
Pottery courses are held at Wellington Potters' Association, 130 Grant Road, Thorndon.
All our courses are scheduled up to a year in advance which means the at times we may need to make changes to the original schedule.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
incl.

id: Live at 5 Wednesdays-Cable Top Eatery, 1 Upland Road, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Live at 5 Wednesdays
venue: Cable Top Eatery, 1 Upland Road, Wellington
description:
Calling all Dancing Queens (and Kings)!
Introducing The Toffee Pops, an electrifying duo that transforms any venue into a pulsating disco wonderland.
With their infectious energy and irresistible setlist of dance party hits, they keep the dance floor buzzing all night long.
You won’t be able to stay in your chair as The Toffee Pops perform “sweet as” songs that will get your toes tapping and your body boogying.
From Donna Summer to Gloria Gaynor to the Bee Gees these Disco Divas will have you strutting your stuff with sassy attitude!

id: Sewing - The Basics-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Sewing - The Basics
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Get the essentials in this one-day workshop and take away your own lined bag, lots of ideas and skills to carry on sewing!
Learn the essential sewing skills you need to get you started in this one-day workshop.
By the end of the workshop, you'll have been introduced to basic sewing skills and you'll be able to: - Use sewing machine equipment and demonstrate basic sewing techniques (basic seams and finishes) - Cut out and construct a lined bag using techniques learned - Line a bag - Work on a pin cushion (if time allows) Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
Prerequisites If you are bringing your own sewing machine to class, we recommend an Electrical Compliance Certificate for all privately-owned electrical equipment used on courses at Wellington High School.

id: Overcoming Imposter Syndrome for Creatives-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Overcoming Imposter Syndrome for Creatives
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Do you often feel your creative work isn't good enough or worry about sharing it with others?
Join our workshop to explore the roots of imposter syndrome and discover practical strategies to boost your confidence, allowing you to proudly showcase your art to the world.
There is a widespread ‘lack of confidence’ epidemic among creatives, and if you have ever felt like your work is not good enough, hesitated to submit your art to competitions, or doubted your skills when applying for creative jobs, you are not alone!
By the end of this workshop, you’ll be able to: Identify and challenge the origins of your imposter syndrome.
Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Plus - there is an amazing plant-based dinner included in your ticket!
What to Expect Guided Elebreath®️ session (conscious, rhythmic breathing and somatic presence) Embodiment practices to awaken sensory awareness and deepen body connection Intuitive visualization cues and energetic attunement Gentle music and sacred space to support emotional and energetic release Closing prompts for reflection and emotional integration You’ll be gently guided back into your own inner landscape—where truth lives, tension releases, and the nervous system finds a place to land.
Contraindications This session involves intentional breath modulation, somatic awareness, and nervous system stimulation.
Please consult a medical professional or get in contact if any of the following apply: Pregnancy (2nd or 3rd trimester especially) History of cardiovascular issues, stroke, or high blood pressure Epilepsy or severe respiratory conditions Diagnosed PTSD, schizophrenia, or other unmanaged mental health conditions Currently taking medications that affect heart rate or nervous system regulation All participants will be guided to listen to their body’s cues.
As the founder of Elebreath®️, her work bridges somatic breathwork, nervous system regulation, and energetic mastery with intuitive embodiment and deep manifestation practices.

id: Acing The Interview-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Acing The Interview
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Resourceful You - Think 2.
Managing You - Feel 3.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Manage your thoughts and critical voice under pressure - Visualise and mentally rehearse for success - Recognise your emotional reactions and manage your emotions under pressure - Utilise techniques to manage anxiety - Demonstrate interview skills and deliver well-formed responses to questions - Understand the star model and other communication techniques and how and when to use them Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
Presented by Tony Yuile.

id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point?
This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction.
Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.
Meet your host, Sivananda Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass.

id: The Warratahs-The Thistle Inn, 3 Mulgrave St, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Warratahs
venue: The Thistle Inn, 3 Mulgrave St, Thorndon, Wellington
description:
The Thistle Inn proudly present one of New Zealand's most Iconic bands for one night only.
A special new album release show- "Burning Daylight".
You might hear the odd cover but really its the sound that The Warratahs have made their own and its become part of the NZ landscape.
Poetic lyrics skidding along on an exciting blend of accordion, fiddle drums, guitars and singing.
$40 General Admission - Doors open 7pm $100 includes 2 course dinner, a glass of bubbly & show - 6.30pm Dinner will be served in our private dining rooms.

id: Quiz Night-Amador, 80 Willis Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Amador, 80 Willis Street, Wellington
description:
Come join us for the newest weekly ritual on a Tuesday night at one of the coolest little venues on Willis St!
You and your crew will negotiate five rounds of amazing trivia with your Gee Quiz host Craig.
Your team's street cred, life smarts and common sense will go a long way to ensuring success on the night.
Add to the mix exquisite beers, delicious food and an incredible vibe, it's the place to be on a Tuesday night with plenty of time for laughter, banter and merrymaking!
The quiz kicks off at 6.30pm and runs for roughly 2 hours.

name: Retirement Reinvented
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington

Whether you’re already retired, or planning ahead, this practical workshop will help you to reflect, re-envision and re-vitalise your life and develop a plan for your future, on your own terms.

id: The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos Transform the exhausting cycle of mental loops, rumination, and decision paralysis into mental clarity and peace.
This 60-minute workshop will give you practical tools to break the cycle.
Plus, your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert—because taking care of your mind is best supported by feeding your body well.
Meet Krishnaloka, your host Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology.
As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms.

id: That F**kn Quiz-Shady Lady, 66 Courtenay Plce, Wellington-Event Finder
name: That F**kn Quiz
venue: Shady Lady, 66 Courtenay Plce, Wellington
description: That F**kn Quiz – The Rudest Quiz in Town!

id: Art/Craft Workshop for Children (5-13yrs)-Moera Community House, 107 Randwick Crescent, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
name: Art/Craft Workshop for Children (5-13yrs)
venue: Moera Community House, 107 Randwick Crescent, Lower Hutt
description:
Our art class is designed to help children unleash their creative potential by providing expert guidance, ample space, and a wide range of art materials and tools.
By encouraging children to explore their imaginations and express themselves in great detail, we inspire them to develop a deeper understanding and appreciation of the world around them.
Through hands-on activities using paints, clay, foam, coloured paper, cardboard, brushes, scissors, and more, children gain the ability not only to appreciate the beauty in life but also to create their own stunning works of art.
Join us to nurture your child's creative talents and inspire their artistic journey!
Time: 3:15 - 4:15 pm, Sundays Location: Moera Community House, Lower Hutt.

id: Paekākāriki Market Day-St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
name: Paekākāriki Market Day
venue: St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki
description:
Come to Paekākāriki for great food and coffee, and visit our monthly Market.
The electric range of stalls includes art, books, candles, ceramics, homeware, plants, food, jewellery, knitted items, second hand items and more.

description:
Think you’ve got the smarts?
Grab your team and head down to the Featherston Tavern every Tuesday night for our legendary Quiz Night!
Whether you’re a quiz veteran or a first-timer, everyone’s welcome.
Entry is free, teams can be any size, and the kitchen and bar are open all night Quiz kicks off at 6.30pm – get in early to grab a table!
Phone 04 472 4045 or email thefeatherston@xtra.co.nz to book your table.

id: Explorers – The Age of Discovery - with James May-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Explorers – The Age of Discovery - with James May
venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
description:
James May will premiere a landmark live theatre show in Australia, New Zealand and Singapore, bringing to life the stories of the extraordinary explorers who traversed the deserts, scaled the mountains, sailed into the unknown.
The live show combines theatrical techniques and James’ charismatic storytelling to create an evening of compelling intellectual entertainment.
From Ice Age migrations to space travel, the stories of famous, infamous and unknown explorers will come to life in a theatric style, presented by British television presenter and award-winning journalist James May.
James May is best known as a co-presenter of the motoring programs Top Gear and The Grand Tour, and as the host of the Our Man in… TV series.
Few endeavors have captured the imagination and spirit of humanity as profoundly as exploration.

id: Mamma Mia!-St James Theatre, 77-87 Courtenay Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Mamma Mia!
venue: St James Theatre, 77-87 Courtenay Place, Wellington
description:
Get ready to say “I Do, I Do, I Do, I Do, I Do!” to the smash-hit jukebox musical based on the songs of Swedish super-group ABBA.
This sunny, funny, international phenomenon unfolds on a Greek island paradise when, on the eve of her wedding, a young woman’s quest to discover the identity of her father brings three men from her mother's past back to the island they last visited 20 years ago.
With music & lyrics by Benny Andersson & Björn Ulvaeus, Mamma Mia!
is written by Catherine Johnson and features non-stop laughs and explosive dance numbers, set to ABBA's hit songs including Super Trouper, Dancing Queen, Knowing Me, Knowing You; Take a Chance on Me, Thank You for the Music, Money, Money, Money; The Winner Takes It All and SOS.
became the 8th longest running show in Broadway history where it played a record-breaking run for 14 years.

id: The Fleetwood Mac Experience-Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton-Event Finder
name: The Fleetwood Mac Experience
venue: Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton
description:
Embark on a musical journey through the iconic era of Fleetwood Mac with “The Fleetwood Mac Experience”.
Immerse yourself in the timeless classics and chart-topping hits that defined a generation, as our talented musicians faithfully recreate the magic and allure of Fleetwood Mac’s unforgettable sound.
From the haunting melodies of Stevie Nicks to the soulful rhythms of Lindsey Buckingham, “The Fleetwood Mac Experience” captures the essence of one of the greatest bands in rock history.
Join us for a night of nostalgia, as we pay homage to the legendary Fleetwood Mac and invite you to experience the passion, the drama, and the extraordinary music that continues to resonate with fans around the world.
Get ready to relive the magic – because with “The Fleetwood Mac Experience” the spirit of Fleetwood Mac lives on.

id: Inspired: Using Notion for Mindful Productivity-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Inspired: Using Notion for Mindful Productivity
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
This is the perfect 60-minute live workshop where Elebreath®️ meets mindful systems—a space to organize your life and business without slipping into hustle mode.
We’ll blend somatic awareness with Notion, the all-in-one tool I use to manage my energy, organize my mind, and create with more ease.
What You’ll Learn: How your nervous system influences focus, clarity, and creative flow How I integrate Elebreath®️ to map my energy before taking action The exact Notion system I use to track tasks, brain dumps, and flow states How to design a dashboard that moves with your body, not against it You’ll Walk Away With: A fully set-up Notion workspace that mirrors your calmest, clearest self A Daily Flow Tracker + Brain Dump Inbox to release the mental clutter Tools to show up consistently—even on low-energy days Included in your ticket: Lifetime access to the free resources like: guided breathwork, fatigue guide, and many more My Notion templates & tracker bundle Bonus PDF: Nervous-System Safe Productivity Rituals An amazing plant-based dinner & dessert!
This is productivity with breath, intention, and soul.
Using Notion as a soul-aligned system, we co-create space for structure, ease, and clarity—so you can live and work in a way that honors your energy.

id: Kpop Party - Friends of Korea x Kick Back Events-Circus Bar, 17b Allen St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Kpop Party - Friends of Korea x Kick Back Events
venue: Circus Bar, 17b Allen St, Wellington
description: Date: Friday 1 August Venue: Circus Bar - 17B Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington Time: 8PM – 11PM PLEASE NOTE: This is an R18 event – ID required upon entry More info on ticket link above.

id: Author Alley-Big Mac Slabs Creative Centre, 289 Mazengarb Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
name: Author Alley
venue: Big Mac Slabs Creative Centre, 289 Mazengarb Rd, Paraparaumu
description:
Indulge in a stroll through Bookmark Kāpiti’s very own Author Alley.
Meet local authors, creatives and service providers within the workshop space of Big Mac Slabs, transformed for one day only in a book-lovers market.
Venture down to discover your next great read and make connections with others in the industry.
Come down anytime between 10–3pm.
Stallholders can register interest via our website.

id: Draw It Out Block Course for Parents of Neurodivergent Children-Draw It Out studio, Level 2, 105 High street, Lower Hutt, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
name: Draw It Out Block Course for Parents of Neurodivergent Children
venue: Draw It Out studio, Level 2, 105 High street, Lower Hutt, Lower Hutt
description:
A unique space to support those who are supporting others.
Parenting can often feel isolating yet many are going through similar journeys.
Dates This block course consists of 4 workshops: 10.30am-11.45am Tuesday 19th August – Re-finding yourself Tuesday 26th August – Caring for your needs Tuesday 2nd September - Self-compassion Tuesday 9th September – Seeing potential Cost $46 per session, $184 total Included in each session You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance.
No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.

id: Yin Yoga & Sound Healing-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Yin Yoga & Sound Healing
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Yin Yoga & Sound Healing Slow yoga, soothing sounds, and a nourishing plant-based meal—a grounding evening from start to finish.
Take a pause from the rush and settle into an evening of deep rest and reconnection.
It’s a chance to soften, breathe, and listen inward.
Sound healing works on a vibrational level—helping to release tension, restore balance, and bring a sense of inner peace.
To close the night, we’ll share a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert—included in your ticket.

id: Ngaio Repair Cafe-Ngaio Repair Cafe, corner Kenya St and Crofton Road, Ngaio, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Ngaio Repair Cafe
venue: Ngaio Repair Cafe, corner Kenya St and Crofton Road, Ngaio, Wellington
description:
Ngaio Repair Café, organised in and by Ngaio Union Church, is part of the worldwide Repair Café movement to cut down waste and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
Our local volunteer repairers will look at and try to fix all sorts of household gear: wooden, metal, electrical, electronic, pottery, computer, fabric, toys, clothing, beads, cardboard – as long as it’s small enough for you to bring.
One of our volunteers is a guitar repairer who can mend and tune any fretted instruments.
Another has an oilstone and will sharpen knives.
While you wait to have your item looked at, tea and coffee and cold drink are provided.

id: Transforming Self-Sabotage: FasterEFT Techniques for Effective Change-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Transforming Self-Sabotage: FasterEFT Techniques for Effective Change
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
You’ll walk away with a personalised action plan to support real, lasting change.
This workshop will help you: •⁠ ⁠Identify your personal self-sabotage patterns and triggers •⁠ ⁠Understand how these patterns affect different areas of your life •⁠ ⁠Recognize the emotional and physiological roots of self-sabotage •⁠ ⁠Learn practical FasterEFT techniques to change sabotaging behaviours •⁠ ⁠Understand the connection between trauma responses and self-sabotaging behaviours Your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert – come for the insight, stay for the meal shared with like-minded others.
Meet Krishnaloka, your host Krishnaloka is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology.
As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms.
Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

id: Finis Omnium iii, Night 1-Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Finis Omnium iii, Night 1
venue: Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
FINIS OMNIUM is back for the third year, this time bigger and better than ever.
Taking place over two hellacious nights featuring some of New Zealand's best metal bands, this is set to be a certified banger!
With two legends of the kiwi scene in Dark Divinity and MetalTower headlining the Friday and Saturday nights respectively, and with support from a gluttony of banger kiwi bands representing multiple sub-genres, these are two must-not-miss nights of carnage to satiate anyone's blood lust.
Tix $20 per night OR $35 for both nights $30 door entry per night.
Get your tickets at

id: Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
(NZ Citizens and residents pay $109 with ID, all others pay $199).
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: • Have a basic understanding of the Māori spiritual and natural worlds (mana atua, mana whenua), and our important connections to them • Identify the sounds of Māori letters and pronounce letter combinations using correct intonation and stress patterns • Confidently greet people, introduce yourself and communicate basic personal information in an informal context • Identify and respond to phrases in the classroom including basic commands/instructions • Confidently describe the day/date, time, and the weather NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
Classes available Tue 22 July 5:30-8:00pm Thu 24 July 6:00-8:30pm

id: Cooking: Mumbai Street Food-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Cooking: Mumbai Street Food
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Take a culinary tour of the streets of Mumbai and learn how to create a range of great Indian foods and snacks.
All ingredients provided.
All ingredients provided but bring an apron, tea towels and a dish cloth and containers to take any leftovers home.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Photography - Unlocking the Secrets to Captivating Images-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Photography - Unlocking the Secrets to Captivating Images
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
This course will help you find the answers to these questions and show you how to transform your photographs into extraordinary, captivating, and memorable images Elevate your photography from ordinary to extraordinary and ensure your work stands out in the digital age.
But how do you turn what you love into something that makes people go, "Wow"?
-Understand why some images linger in memory and how to make your photographs unforgettable.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
Feel passionate about photography but need fresh ideas on what to photograph and how to truly stand out.

id: Crime Writing - An Introduction-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Crime Writing - An Introduction
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Join successful crime author Cat Connor as she shows you where and how!
Bring notebook and pens.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Create an outline for a crime novel or short story.
Construct characters’ maps and believable characters.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells-Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells
venue: Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
The new pieces commissioned for this series continue to stretch at the fabric of jazz and improvised forms, and are inspired by Morton Feldman, Lennie Tristano, Henry Threadgill and Sly Stone.
Callum has been deeply involved in the New Zealand jazz and improvised music scene for over a decade, and is a busy freelancer in the wider music community in Auckland.
He has performed with Aldous Harding, Hans Pucket, the Exploding Rainbow Orchestra, the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra, among many others.
In 2021, Callum was commissioned to compose a large-scale work 'Solid Spirit, Liquid Body' for the Wellington Jazz Festival.
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers.

id: Paint and Wine Night - Cluckin' Fabulous-The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Paint and Wine Night - Cluckin' Fabulous
venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
No previous painting experience necessary.
Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.
Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.
All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass).
At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

id: Remarkable reds and Candlelit canapes-Poppies Martinborough Cellar Door, 91 Puruatanga road, Martinborough-Event Finder
name: Remarkable reds and Candlelit canapes
venue: Poppies Martinborough Cellar Door, 91 Puruatanga road, Martinborough
description:
Arrive from 5.30pm and take your time — the fire will be lit, the first glasses poured, and the room quietly glowing.
From 6pm, we’ll begin serving a series of canapé-style small plates, thoughtfully matched to a selection of our favourite red wines.
Wines and plates will flow throughout the evening, each one designed to complement the mood of midwinter — rich, warming, and generous.
As always, we’re offering tickets first to our subscription and club members — and they tend to go quickly.
Price: $80.00 per ticket.

id: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing Slow down, settle in, and let the soft glow of the moon guide you inward.
This calming evening will centre around the deeply restorative practice of Yoga Nidra—a guided meditation designed to bring your body into a state of deep rest while your awareness gently drifts between waking and dreaming.
Known to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress, Yoga Nidra supports emotional balance, mental clarity, and a profound sense of ease.
This moon-themed session invites you to tune into the gentle, reflective energy of the lunar cycle—a time for slowing down, softening, and simply being.
After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together.

id: Quiz Night-Kelburn Village Pub, 87 Upland Rd, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Kelburn Village Pub, 87 Upland Rd, Kelburn, Wellington
description:
Come join us and legendary host Savage for the weekly ritual on a Tuesday night, where you and your crew will negotiate five rounds of amazing trivia with Gee Quiz.
Your team's street cred, life smarts and common sense will go a long way to ensuring success on the night.
Add to the mix exquisite cocktails, delicious food and an incredible vibe, it's the place to be on a Tuesday night with plenty of time for laughter, banter and merrymaking!
The quiz kicks off at 7pm and runs for roughly 2 hours.
So, grab your buddies and come on down and join us for one of Ponsonby’s best quiz nights – KVP style!

id: Quiz Night-Eva Beva, 31-35 Dixon Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Eva Beva, 31-35 Dixon Street, Wellington
description:

Kicking off at 7pm, the quiz offers five rounds of big-screen trivia that's not too hard, not too easy, but includes content that relates to you and your crew!
So if you've got some street smarts, a good attitude, and a dash of luck, you'll be a good chance on the night.
Add to the mix some bonus games, great food & drink, a stack of prizes, great banter and laughs aplenty, it's the place to be on a Wednesday for a rollicking good time!

id: Meet the Maker - Tom Turner from Martinborough Vineyard-The Runholder, 89 Martins Road, Martinborough-Event Finder
name: Meet the Maker - Tom Turner from Martinborough Vineyard
venue: The Runholder, 89 Martins Road, Martinborough
description:
Join us at The Runholder for a relaxed afternoon or evening with some of their wine and spirit makers.
Each Friday in August, a different maker will be on hand, pouring something special (to be revealed!)
and guiding tastings in an informal, drop-in style setting.
As one of the first to plant Pinot Noir, in 1980, Martinborough Vineyard now lay claim to the oldest Pinot Noir vines not only Martinborough, but also New Zealand.

id: Moon Jam Nite-Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Moon Jam Nite
venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington
description:
Newtown's favourite jam night!
A weekly showcase of the musical talents of Newtown & beyond Come and share your original tunes, jam with other musicians, or simply enjoy the show & drink specials!
Electric guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, mics, lights and mixer provided, along with support from our in-house sound tech Billy.
Bring your own gear, cymbals, songs, & poems.
Free entry, sign ups from 7pm, every Tuesday.

id: Expressive Watercolour - 5 Week Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Expressive Watercolour - 5 Week Course
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
Watercolour is special because of the fluid properties that produce spontaneous and unique results.
The inability to anticipate exactly what the paint will do makes watercolour an exciting medium to work with.
- Learn about transparent colour mixing to create luminosity in your paintings.
- Study the relationship between line and colour and the different ways they can be combined to find a personal style.
Evenings: Thursdays, 6-8 pm 14 August - 11 September.

id: International Packraft Film Festival - Wellington-Penthouse Cinema, 205 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington-Event Finder
name: International Packraft Film Festival - Wellington
venue: Penthouse Cinema, 205 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington
description:
Join PRANZ and Blue Duck Packrafts for the Wellington screening of the International Packrafting Film Festival 2025.
What to Expect.... - A night of soulful river journeys and epic whitewater.
- First descents, big swims, wild country, and quiet moments.
- Films by paddlers, for paddlers — with stories that matter.
- A chance to connect with the local community and chat with local suppliers.

id: Zentangle Method - Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Zentangle Method - Beginners
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Zentangle method is an easy to learn, relaxing and fun method to create amazing images by drawing structured patterns.
In this course you will learn to make beautiful zen-art, following the 8 steps of the Zentangle method from a certified Zentangle teacher.
Description The Zentangle method is an easy-to-learn, relaxing and fun method to create amazing images by drawing structured patterns.
In this course you will learn to make beautiful art, following the 8 steps of the Zentangle method from a certified Zentangle teacher.
Discover your creative side, even if you think you don’t have one.

Last time was so much fun we just had to go in again!

id: Bojack Funkman-The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Bojack Funkman
venue: The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington
description:
Fronted by Ben Hunt, Kaito Walley, and Eilish Wilson (aka the Horn Section of Doom) with an all-star cast of rhythm section virtuosos, this crossover episode brings together Lettuce, Dave Guy, Ezra Collective, and some hometown bangers.
Stay home?
Neigh way, José!
Special guests: Jade Merematira (vocals) and Louis TM (vocals/keys) Also featuring: Ben Hunt - trumpet Kaito Walley - trombone Eilish Wilson - saxophone Petar Tavich - guitar Emma Hattaway - bass Jacob Randall - drums Music from 9:30, FREE ENTRY, koha for the band encouraged

Kicking off at 7pm, the quiz offers five rounds of big-screen trivia that's not too hard, not too easy, but includes content that relates to you and your crew!
So if you've got some street smarts, a good attitude, and a dash of luck, you'll be a good chance on the night.

id: The Bebop Brigade-The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Bebop Brigade
venue: The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington
description:
Burning tempo?
Cymbal crash?
This hot new quintet is equipped with all the finest bebop tunes from the 40s and 50s and is ready to go at a moment's notice.
Appearing for the first time at the Undercurrent, the band is excited to present a new set of rare tunes and bop classics.
Expect exhilarating swing, gorgeous ballads, and intricate melodies.

id: Ration the Queen's Veges-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Ration the Queen's Veges
venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No.
Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien.
ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood.
While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.

id: Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
A one-of-a-kind yoga experience designed to awaken the senses, stir reflection, and bring you into deeper connection — followed by a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert.
Take this moment to become grounded in your true nature through embodied movement.
This practice is your invitation to appreciate and develop a deeper connection with the Earth — to slow down, to notice the changing landscapes and seasons around you, and to find them within you.
As you move through gentle hatha yoga, you’ll be surrounded by breathtaking visuals of our earthly home, designed and projected by Andy from Hype Entertainment.
Let us find our way back through nature, to our true nature and selves.

id: Reiki Infused Sound Healing-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Reiki Infused Sound Healing
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Reiki Infused Sound Healing Sink into a meditative sanctuary of stillness with Nizaad — a healing energy practitioner and space holder rooted in ancestral wisdom, sound, and ceremony.
Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert after the event - all included in your ticket!
Come as you are.
Let the sound carry you into stillness, and the energy bring gentle release.
Blending the healing frequencies of crystal singing bowls alongside other sacred instruments, her sessions are rooted in the belief that sound and energy are medicine.

id: Cooking: Homemade Chinese Egg Noodles And Pan-Fried Buns-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Cooking: Homemade Chinese Egg Noodles And Pan-Fried Buns
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Keen to make your own meat buns but unsure where to start?
Come and discover how you can easily replicate these delicious specialities at home.
The meat buns you create are soft with succulent and juicy meat filling, perfect for a simple breakfast, lunch, or as a snack.
Some communal ingredients will be supplied but a list of additional ingredients needed will be sent out when course numbers are confirmed.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Make a selection of Chinese egg noodles and buns to take home - Understand more about the Chinese egg noodle-making process - Understand more about the Chinese bun-making process - Feel more confident to make Chinese egg noodles and buns by hand at home Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Best of the Bee Gees Saturday Night Fever Show-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Best of the Bee Gees Saturday Night Fever Show
venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
description:
You should be dancing when the disco era comes alive on stage in Wellington.
Released in 1977, the album defined a disco generation.
Special guests Debora McLane (niece of the Bee Gees) and Roslyn Loxton join the tribute band on stage.
The album ‘Saturday Night Fever’ was the biggest-selling sound recording between 1977 and 1980.
It was awarded Album of the Year at the 1979 Grammys and stayed in the Top 200 for 29 consecutive months.

venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington

Funded in part by a grant from the Wellington City Council!

id: Yuzu Fest 2025-Garage Project Wild Workshop, 7 Furness Lane Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Yuzu Fest 2025
venue: Garage Project Wild Workshop, 7 Furness Lane Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
description:
Get ready to pucker up – Yuzu Fest is back and juicier than ever!
Our annual celebration of all things citrus is returning in epic fashion, and the 2025 lineup is absolute gold.
We’re talking the triumphant return of fan faves like Yuzu Pernicious Weed and the sell-out sensation Yuzukoshu, alongside some fresh new zesty creations.
Come sip your way through our week-long Yuzu Fest across all Garage Project venues.
Whether you're a long-time lover of all things yuzu or just here for the citrusy vibes, this is one week you won't want to miss.

id: Quiz Night-Duke of Wellington, 29 Waterloo Quay, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Duke of Wellington, 29 Waterloo Quay, Wellington
description:
Come join us and Legendary host Sammy Win-Win for the weekly ritual on a Wednesday night, where you and your crew will negotiate five rounds of amazing trivia with Gee Quiz.
Your team's street cred, life smarts and common sense will go a long way to ensuring success on the night.
Add to the delicious food and an incredible vibe, it's the place to be on a Wednesday night with plenty of time for laughter, banter and merrymaking!

id: Beervana 2025 presented by Liquorland-Sky Stadium, 105 Waterloo Quay, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Beervana 2025 presented by Liquorland
venue: Sky Stadium, 105 Waterloo Quay, Wellington
description: Raise a glass and celebrate the best of beer at Beervana 2025!

id: Psychology of Money Management-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Psychology of Money Management
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Once you understand how you regard money, you can take control of yours!
In this workshop, we're not here to tell you to cut your budget or skip your favourite treats.
Instead, we’ll come together to design a financial plan tailored to your unique needs, making you feel confident, excited, and in control.
In this workshop, you’ll explore the psychology of money and how it influences your financial decisions.
A step-by-step planning process will be taught by working through a case study.

id: The Sound Inside-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Sound Inside
venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Bella Baird is a brilliant Ivy League writing professor.
Christopher is a talented yet mysterious student.
Between real-life and literary fiction, an unusual friendship grows between lonely souls.
Until Bella asks an unthinkable favour.
A gripping yet delicate new play that explores the limits of what one person can ask of another; beautiful in its writing and thrilling in its drama.

id: New Zealand Book Awards for Children & Young Adults Ceremony 2025-Pipitea Marae, 55 Thorndon Quay, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
name: New Zealand Book Awards for Children & Young Adults Ceremony 2025
venue: Pipitea Marae, 55 Thorndon Quay, Thorndon, Wellington
description:
Buy your tickets now for the 2025 New Zealand Book Awards for Children and Young Adults to join the celebration of the best books of the year for young New Zealand readers.
You’ll get to meet the finalists and applaud the winners at an exuberant awards ceremony in the characterful Pipitea Marae on Wednesday 13 August.
Their achievements will be acknowledged on the night by publishers, politicians, booksellers, librarians, media and supporters of the children’s literature community.
Members of the public are welcome to purchase tickets too.
This is a popular event with a limited number of seats, so book your place today and enjoy this wonderful celebration of Aotearoa’s very best children’s literature.

id: No Menu Night-Colombo Martinborough, 107 Todds Road, Martinborough-Event Finder
name: No Menu Night
venue: Colombo Martinborough, 107 Todds Road, Martinborough
description:
A flavour-packed Friday evening at Colombo Martinborough, catered by local legends Good Times Food.
Join us on Friday 22nd August from 5.30pm for a surprise main dish that’s anything but ordinary.
There’s no set menu – just one banging dish, crafted with bold, globally inspired flavours and the best local ingredients.
Think of it as fine food in your best jandals: fresh, fun, and unapologetically delicious.
Trust the chefs and prepare to say “bloody yum!”

id: Friday Laughs with Lesa Macleod-Whiting and Kura Forrester-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Friday Laughs with Lesa Macleod-Whiting and Kura Forrester
venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
description:
Friday Laughs is a two hour comedy showcase of some top Kiwi talent, right in the heart of Wellington.
Winner of the 2019 Billy T Award, Kura is fast becoming one of the standout comedian actors of New Zealand.
She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest.
She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.
Winner – Best Newcomer – 2020 Wellington Comedy Awards Nominated – Best Newcomer (Lower North Island) – 2020 NZ Comedy Guild Awards Along with Sandy Burton Alayne Dick Leki Lyons and Mike Fowler

id: Dried Flowers - Meadow Hoop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Dried Flowers - Meadow Hoop
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Come and learn how to make a dried flower meadow hoop (25cm wide) with Red Ruth from Bloomin Heck Wreaths.
Come along to this workshop and make a dried flower meadow hoop using a combination of dried flowers and foliage (30cm wide).
Enrol with a family member or friend or come and make new friends!
The fee includes all dried flowers, foliage, hoop and box to carry your floral art in.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

id: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Transform your relationship with anxiety in just 60 minutes using the revolutionary FasterEFT technique that's helping thousands worldwide break free from the grip of panic and overwhelm.
In "Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind," you'll discover how your mind creates anxiety through unconscious patterns and learn a simple yet powerful tapping method to literally rewire your nervous system for calm and confidence.
Unlike traditional therapy that can take months or years, FasterEFT works at the subconscious level where anxiety is actually created, allowing you to experience immediate relief and lasting change.
Whether you struggle with daily worry, panic attacks, or overwhelming stress, this workshop will give you practical tools to take control of your mental state and create the peaceful, confident life you deserve.
Leave with a complete system you can use anywhere, anytime to transform anxiety into inner peace.

id: Quiz Night-Cambridge Hotel, 28 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Cambridge Hotel, 28 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
description:
It's the famous Worth It Wednesday Quiz Night at The Camby!
Come down for Wellington’s longest-running quiz, grab some mates and come down for a burger and beer for just $25!
Kicking off at 6.30pm, you and your crew will be flexing your mental clout through five rounds of big screen trivia, the Bonus Baffler, The Line Up and Last Person Standing!
There’s a bunch of prizes to be won, so you’ll need to bring your A-game on quiz night to succeed!
Follow the Facebook pages for updates and new quiz dates for 2025!

id: Winterlude-The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Winterlude
venue: The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington
description:
We are thrilled to announce… Winterlude: A night of original songs and verse.
Winterlude is a series of intimate winter concerts involving poets and singers/songwriters.
The first of these took place last year in Mana Little Theatre in Plimmerton and at the Coastal Musical Theatre in Kapiti, both to well received sold out shows.
We are very excited to be hosting their Wellington debut!
Performers are: Barry Saunders (Warratahs) Caroline Easther (with friends) Alan Galloway (with Tatiana Sogrina) Poet Nikki-Lee Birdsey Poet Rebekah Burgess Doors 6:30 pm/Gig 7:00 pm Tickets $25 available on the door and online.
